page.title: 08St. Mary's Church: Broughton
page.content: St. Mary's Church is in the grounds of {Broughton Castle}. It was built by {Sir John de Broughton} who died in 1315. He was a knight of Edward I. In the church there is an octagonal pulpit where the Rector stands. It has the tomb of Sir John de Broughton in the church. The congregation is about {sixty people}. On the floor there are lots of inscriptions. The windows are stained glass. Lord and Lady Thomas are buried in the church and Lord Saye & Sele who died in 1662 and his wife who died in 1648. There are many {hatchments} which are diamond shaped pieces of canvas bearing the coat of arms of the person that died. There are brasses and wall paintings. {Bishop Carpenter School} is the parish school supported by the church. The church has a {Sunday School}. Adam Williams.
